boat.name: Widget
boat.full_description: Described as a keel / centreboard day sailer designed by Joel White, she is in fact a development of a design by Nat Herreshoff know as the Buzzards Bay 12.5 from 1914. The 12.5 relates to the waterline length, in feet. The White design reduced the overall draft and incorporated a centre plate which dropped through the 600lb lead keel. The original design was of carvel construction with 1/2 cedar planks screwed to steam bent oak ribs; the Widget design has been further modified to allow cedar strip and epoxy construction which has been glass sheathed.
boat.construction_details:
Cedar strip construction with fibreglass / Sicomin epoxy sheathing inside and out. Keel logs are English oak. She has mahogany and teak decking and trim and a solid mahogany transom. The fore deck has a 12 mm marine ply sub-deck with red teak straight laid boards which are sheathed in glass to show off the beautiful wood. All brightwork is finished with Tonkinois traditional varnish.

The mast and spars are solid Douglas fir and she has a 250kg lead keel with integral marine ply lifting centreplate. Standing rigging was supplied by Traditional Rigging of Bristol and the majority of fittings are bronze; the running rigging is ‘hemp’ lookalike cordage. The sails were made by Rowsell of Exmouth.
boat.short_description: A keel / centreboard day sailer designed by Joel White, based on Nat Herreshoff's Buzzards Bay 12.5 from 1914.
